text: Molecular basis of Hb H and AEBart's diseases in the Lao People's Democratic Republic. INTRODUCTION: As compared to other neighboring countries, limited information on alpha-thalassemia diseases is available for Lao PDR. We reported for the first time a genetic diversity associated with Hb H and AEBart's diseases in Laos patients. METHODS: Study was done on Laos patients with Hb H disease (n = 14) and AEBart's disease (n = 14) whose blood specimens were transferred to our laboratory for the investigation of thalassemia. Hematological parameters were recorded. Hb analysis was done using a capillary electrophoresis system. alpha- and beta-globin genotypes were determined using PCR and related techniques. RESULTS: Hb and DNA analyses identified Hb H disease resulted from [--SEA /-alpha3.7 , betaA /betaA ] (n = 7), [--THAI /-alpha3.7 , betaA /betaA ] (n = 1), Hb H-Constant Spring (CS) disease (--SEA /alphaCS alpha, betaA /betaA ; n = 5), and Hb H-IVSI-117 (--SEA /alphaalphaIVSI-117G>A , betaA /betaA ; n = 1). For those of the AEBart's disease (n = 14), five were found to be AEBart's-CS disease [--SEA /alphaCS alpha, betaE /betaA ], two had [--THAI /alphaCS alpha, betaE /betaA ] genotype, six had AEBart's disease with (--SEA /-alpha3.7 , betaE /betaA ) genotype, and the remaining one was a patient with AEBart's-Pakse' [--SEA /alphaPS alpha, betaE /betaA ] disease. These --THAI and alphaIVSI-117G>A mutations are reported herein for the first time in Laos population. Accurate diagnosis in most cases was obtained after DNA analysis. CONCLUSIONS: This study demonstrates the diverse heterogeneity and highlights the importance of molecular diagnosis of alpha-thalassemia diseases in Laos population. Data on the molecular basis of alpha-thalassemia should prove useful for setting up a molecular diagnostic testing for thalassemia in Laos and further hemoglobin genetic study in the region.
